column5: http://white-pine-lodge.ca June 4-8 Balsam Lake July 20-27 Still looking to book another week fist week of October.
I don't want to say after reading Mike's list!

Starting the season off with a week long canoe trip in Algonquin park May 10th, then a few trips to the big o for some salmon and browns, the last week of July will be spent chasing lakers on the big rideau and finally a week in New Brunswick for Atlantic salmon and stripers. Naturally I'll be making my regular trips to the larry for muskies and as many outings in my backyard on the Ottawa as I can manage.  Gotta lotta fishn to do this year lol
We'll be hitting the West Arm and Nippissing in early August for a week - then 2 weeks in September on the French River. I have a feeling this is the year for the 50+

Lake Kipawa, QC in late-July...15th year running...always great fishing and awesome scenery. Can't wait.  That Borger list is nice, but I'm confident my family would vacate the house and leave me for good after about trip #4...

Will be heading down to wyoming/montana for a week of back country trout fishing in august, going to plan for week in algonquin sometime in september and will inevitably make a few trips to Gbay, bancroft, states in the fall, usual stuff.

lots of states trips, wyoming, Washington, Florida, Oregon, North and South Dakota and probably B.C. summer and fall trips, will be a nice tour. Other then that, the usual stuff, Bancroft, Algonquin, Minden, North Bay, Michigan, Minnesota, Ohio, Pennsylvania, etc. Most of them will be states trips though.
Fly-in trip end of July (thanks Mr. Borger ) with my 6 year old.  Just him and I.

Will be heading down to wyoming/montana for a week of back country trout fishing in august, going to plan for week in algonquin sometime in september and will inevitably make a few trips to Gbay, bancroft, states in the fall, usual stuff. Make sure you hit up the Big Hole for some grayling young man
Where's that? We'll be focusing on yellowstone but I'd love to hook into some grayling while there!

That Borger list is nice, but I'm confident my family would vacate the house and leave me for good after about trip #4...  They're accompanying me on several of them, the rest are all business trips.  Thankfully my wife is not only my best friend, she's my biggest supporter.
Where's that? We'll be focusing on yellowstone but I'd love to hook into some grayling while there! http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Big_Hole_River
French river 10 or more times. Lake of the woods for 2 weeks. Nipigon for 1 week. And a bunch of lake o trips.

First off.. Mike... will you adopt me?  July down to Long Point Inner Bay 1st wk August...Eagle Lake Sundridge...smallies / pike ( yeah pikeys are in there now ) 1st wk Sept....Port Loring area 2nd wk Sept.....Balsam Lake

One week of  pike fishing on the Taltson River....Great Slave Lake plus an additional 3 days for Lake Trout just 20 air miles from Yellowknife NWT on Hearne Lake.Hopefully I'll have some good trip reports.
Kipawa for the May long, and the rest of my adventures will be around the endless lakes and rivers in my backyard.

well last summer in 1 month of holidays i fished 13 new lakes !!!! and some are for sure back on the hit list !!!! and my usual 2-3 trips to the mighty ottawa river for walleyes and then switch over for bass most of the summer !!!! hundreds of hours in the lund as usual !!!!
I love hitting new lakes, especially local ones.  Lots and lots of choices around here, that's for sure.  We definitely shouldn't have a lack of reports with all the great trips people have planned.

We definitely shouldn't have a lack of reports with all the great trips people have planned.  Seriously!!!  Some great fishing for many.  Will be looking forward to reading about plenty in the fall.  Work has clamped down on me here.  Bren and I are headed to the Arctic, but all other plans are in limbo until May 15th.  Come then the planning begins.
may 22 I'm heading down to Eagle Lake for our annual boys get together , if the ice is out!!!!!!!!

First trip this year will be a 9 day fly-in to Lac Hebert with Tamarac Air 20-29 Jun for walleyes and northerns (http://www.tamarac.ca/php/en/hebert_profil.php) Second trip will be our eighth consecutive year at Club Trout Lake 15-23 Aug for walleyes, lake trout and northerns (http://www.clubtroutlake.com/)
hey mike,im going to dayohessarah may 30-june 6th...supposed to be a killer fishery...when you going?worried about ice?i am

Three trips to Crane's on the French....Early June. Early July, and late September.  One trip to Bulldozer Lake outpost thru White River Air in mid August.  The rest of the Spring, Summer, and Fall I'll be chasing trout with a fly rod on Michigan's Au Sable River. WE have a cabin on one of its feeder streams. That season has begun well. Couple pics attached.
I'd love to spend a few days in Michigan chasing big resident brownies!

With the soft water season almost underway..... I have already booked my "fly-in" trip for this year. Thanks in part to Mr. Borger, I am headed to Marshall Lake near Nakina in mid September for some big pike and a plethora of eye's. My first trip to northern Ontario.  Where is everyone else headed for their "big trips" this year?
As I do every year, I'll be chasing muskies on the West Arm of Nipissing for a week in June and another 2 weeks in August.  I've fished in a lot of places but have never found a place I like better.

Pike trip near timmins in may, a week off in august that will either be another pike trip or a week of salmon derby fishing in lake ontario, and more than likely a muskie adventure to somewhere during late october.

Got alot to take care of around the house this summer. but hoping to get to camp as much as possible, got our annual Kesagami trip in late July and hopefully a fly-in with the kids to Partridge Lake before we send Jaden off to University in August.
Fly in with Hearst Air in September ... but need to get lots of other fishing in before then
Eddie's Windsor Lake camp on the Attawapiskat in mid July. I've had my eye on that camp for years but couldn't justify the drive to Armstrong. Now that Eddie picked it up, away we go....

As I do every year, I'll be chasing muskies on the West Arm of Nipissing for a week in June and another 2 weeks in August.  I've fished in a lot of places but have never found a place I like better. Do you ever venture in the the upper french Lew? I am usually up there the 2nd weekend in Aug at my uncles cottage. Good Muskie fishing in there as well so I am told. Had a follow last year from a big one while fishing for smallies.
Hoping to make a trip to Pasha Lake Cabins, seems like a cool place and maybe a fly-in trip wherever Mike Boerger sends me lol...although he doesn't know that yet. lol
Fly-in at the end of May, White Otter start of July, another fly-in mid july,  and Nipigon like always in August.

Do you ever venture in the the upper french Lew?  I've fished it a couple times but without too much success.  I've been going to the West Arm for 10 years or so now and know the area well and usually do good with the muskies, so that's the reason I keep going back.

i am tasked with picking the spot for our annual boys canoe/fishing trip this year.  End of september we will be heading up to some lakes off the beaten path of the spanish river area.  If anyone has alot of experience with that area (west of the spanish) i would appreciate talking to them
I'm going to have to sneak aboard Lews boat one time this year
I'm going to have to sneak aboard Lews boat one time this year  No sneaking required Bill, we'll try and make it work this year for sure.
I'm going to have to sneak aboard Lews boat one time this year One of the better trips I've had since living up this way !!!

One of the better trips I've had since living up this way !!!  That was a great day Norm, really enjoyed spending the day with you.  Unfortunately I lost a whole whack of pictures from my computer  a couple years ago and the ones from that day were among them.
Sounds like a good excuse to get some more pics!   Lew, you catch the fish, I'll make them all look like 80lb monsters
Temagami in May, then again in July with the children. Hopefully make at least 1 to 2 more trips to Temagami over the summer months. I live for Temagami!!!

Have the annual boys week away in May for some back country lake trout (ice or no ice we are going) End of June hit some hidden bass lakes , couple more trips to the lake trout spot for some big smallmouth and some deepwater lake trout jigging (lotsa fun) Pike tourney in September , more bassin in October and spend some time at the trailer in Parry sound in between . I'm booked , can't wait

Big year on tap for me:  1.Dayohessarah Lake with White River Air in Late May for lake trout. http://www.northtoadventure.com/lake_detail.php?lid=13  2.North Caribou Lake Camp in late June for giant pike and walleye. http://www.northcaribou.com/  3.Asheweig River for trophy brookies in mid July. http://asheweigriver.com/index.php?pid=29  4.Medhurst Lake outpost in the Chapleau region in early August. http://www.ontariowilderness.com/lake.php?id=Medhurst  5.Sutton River for giant brook trout in late August. http://hearstair.wordpress.com/sutton-river-specs/  6.Cree Lake in northern Saskatchewan mid September for giant lakers and pike. http://www.borealcamps.com/creehp.htm  7.Anjigaming Lake outpost in Chapleau in late September (with the winners of the fly in trip contest) http://www.outpostcamps.com/destinations/   Trying to fit in another trip with Mattice Lake Outfitters in Armstrong and another to Chaudiere Lodge on the upper French.

Big year on tap for me:  1.Dayohessarah Lake with White River Air in Late May for lake trout. http://www.northtoadventure.com/lake_detail.php?lid=13  2.North Caribou Lake Camp in late June for giant pike and walleye. http://www.northcaribou.com/  3.Asheweig River for trophy brookies in mid July. http://asheweigriver.com/index.php?pid=29  4.Medhurst Lake outpost in the Chapleau region in early August. http://www.ontariowilderness.com/lake.php?id=Medhurst  5.Sutton River for giant brook trout in late August. http://hearstair.wordpress.com/sutton-river-specs/  6.Cree Lake in northern Saskatchewan mid September for giant lakers and pike. http://www.borealcamps.com/creehp.htm  7.Anjigaming Lake outpost in Chapleau in late September (with the winners of the fly in trip contest) http://www.outpostcamps.com/destinations/   Trying to fit in another trip with Mattice Lake Outfitters in Armstrong and another to Chaudiere Lodge on the upper French. My goodness.
Thought I had a busy summer planned , very nice Mike !
Just got back from 7 weeks chasing salty fish in Florida and will be heading to Alaska in September for 5 weeks to chase trout and sammins!!!
Lew, you catch the fish, I'll make them all look like 80lb monsters  Your the kind of fish'n partner I like Bill

May 12th - 16 Algonquin May 19th-23 Algonquin May 26th-30 Algonquin Again June 2nd-6th North of 17 River Brookies June 9th - 13th  Again Northern River Brookies  Every Tues - Friday July and August a cabin on the middle Geen
Going on a fly-in with Mike Borger in September, I am going to win that Ontario Out of Doors contest
